briefdescription.para: Returns the list of items in the menu.

detaileddescription.para: wxMenuItemList is a pseudo-template list class containing wxMenuItem pointers, see wxList.

briefdescription.para: Returns the list of items in the menu.

detaileddescription.para: wxMenuItemList is a pseudo-template list class containing wxMenuItem pointers, see wxList.

briefdescription.para: Constructs a wxMenu object.
Constructs a wxMenu object.

parameterdescription.para: If set to wxMENU_TEAROFF, the menu will be detachable (wxGTK only).

briefdescription.para: Constructs a wxMenu object with a title.

parameterdescription.para: Title at the top of the menu (not always supported).
If set to wxMENU_TEAROFF, the menu will be detachable (wxGTK only).

briefdescription.para: Destructor, destroying the menu.

simplesect.para: Under Motif, a popup menu must have a valid parent (the window it was last popped up on) when being destroyed. Therefore, make sure you delete or re-use the popup menu before destroying the parent window. Re-use in this context means popping up the menu on a different window from last time, which causes an implicit destruction and recreation of internal data structures.

memberdef.argsstring: (int id, const wxString &item=wxEmptyString, const wxString &helpString=wxEmptyString, wxItemKind kind=wxITEM_NORMAL)
memberdef.name: Append

briefdescription.para: Adds a menu item.

detaileddescription.para:
id
The menu command identifier.
item
The string to appear on the menu item. See wxMenuItem::SetItemLabel() for more details.
helpString
An optional help string associated with the item. By default, the handler for the wxEVT_MENU_HIGHLIGHT event displays this string in the status line.
kind
May be wxITEM_SEPARATOR, wxITEM_NORMAL, wxITEM_CHECK or wxITEM_RADIO.
Example: m_pFileMenu->Append(ID_NEW_FILE,"&Newfile\tCTRL+N","CreatesanewXYZdocument"); or even better for stock menu items (see wxMenuItem::wxMenuItem): m_pFileMenu->Append(wxID_NEW,"","CreatesanewXYZdocument");

simplesect.para: This command can be used after the menu has been shown, as well as on initial creation of a menu or menubar.
AppendSeparator(), AppendCheckItem(), AppendRadioItem(), AppendSubMenu(), Insert(), SetLabel(), GetHelpString(), SetHelpString(), wxMenuItem

memberdef.argsstring: (int id, const wxString &item, wxMenu *subMenu, const wxString &helpString=wxEmptyString)
memberdef.name: Append

briefdescription.para: Adds a submenu.

xrefdescription.para: This function is deprecated, use AppendSubMenu() instead.

parameterdescription.para: The string to appear on the menu item.
An optional help string associated with the item. By default, the handler for the wxEVT_MENU_HIGHLIGHT event displays this string in the status line.

simplesect.para: AppendSeparator(), AppendCheckItem(), AppendRadioItem(), AppendSubMenu(), Insert(), SetLabel(), GetHelpString(), SetHelpString(), wxMenuItem

briefdescription.para: Adds a menu item object.

detaileddescription.para: This is the most generic variant of Append() method because it may be used for both items (including separators) and submenus and because you can also specify various extra properties of a menu item this way, such as bitmaps and fonts.

parameterdescription.para: A menuitem object. It will be owned by the wxMenu object after this function is called, so do not delete it yourself.

simplesect.para: See the remarks for the other Append() overloads.
AppendSeparator(), AppendCheckItem(), AppendRadioItem(), AppendSubMenu(), Insert(), SetLabel(), GetHelpString(), SetHelpString(), wxMenuItem

briefdescription.para: Adds a checkable item to the end of the menu.
Adds a radio item to the end of the menu.

detaileddescription.para: All consequent radio items form a group and when an item in the group is checked, all the others are automatically unchecked.

simplesect.para: Radio items are not supported under wxMotif.

briefdescription.para: Adds a separator to the end of the menu.
Adds the given submenu to this menu.

detaileddescription.para: text is the text shown in the menu for it and help is the help string shown in the status bar when the submenu item is selected.

briefdescription.para: Inserts a break in a menu, causing the next appended item to appear in a new column.
Checks or unchecks the menu item.

parameterdescription.para: If true, the item will be checked, otherwise it will be unchecked.

briefdescription.para: Deletes the menu item from the menu.

detaileddescription.para: If the item is a submenu, it will not be deleted. Use Destroy() if you want to delete a submenu.

parameterdescription.para: Id of the menu item to be deleted.

briefdescription.para: Deletes the menu item from the menu.

detaileddescription.para: If the item is a submenu, it will not be deleted. Use Destroy() if you want to delete a submenu.

briefdescription.para: Deletes the menu item from the menu.

detaileddescription.para: If the item is a submenu, it will be deleted. Use Remove() if you want to keep the submenu (for example, to reuse it later).

parameterdescription.para: Id of the menu item to be deleted.

briefdescription.para: Deletes the menu item from the menu.

detaileddescription.para: If the item is a submenu, it will be deleted. Use Remove() if you want to keep the submenu (for example, to reuse it later).

briefdescription.para: Enables or disables (greys out) a menu item.

parameterdescription.para: true to enable the menu item, false to disable it.

briefdescription.para: Finds the menu item object associated with the given menu item identifier and, optionally, the position of the item in the menu.

detaileddescription.para: Unlike FindItem(), this function doesn't recurse but only looks at the direct children of this menu.

parameterdescription.para: The identifier of the menu item to find.
If the pointer is not NULL, it is filled with the item's position if it was found or (size_t)wxNOT_FOUND otherwise.

simplesect.para: Menu item object or NULL if not found.

briefdescription.para: Finds the menu id for a menu item string.

simplesect.para: Menu item identifier, or wxNOT_FOUND if none is found.
Any special menu codes are stripped out of source and target strings before matching.

briefdescription.para: Finds the menu item object associated with the given menu item identifier and, optionally, the (sub)menu it belongs to.

parameterdescription.para: If the pointer is not NULL, it will be filled with the item's parent menu (if the item was found)

simplesect.para: Menu item object or NULL if none is found.

briefdescription.para: Returns the wxMenuItem given a position in the menu.
Returns the help string associated with a menu item.

simplesect.para: The help string, or the empty string if there is no help string or the item was not found.

briefdescription.para: Returns a menu item label.

simplesect.para: The item label, or the empty string if the item was not found.

briefdescription.para: Returns a menu item label, without any of the original mnemonics and accelerators.

simplesect.para: The item label, or the empty string if the item was not found.

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of items in the menu.
Returns the title of the menu.
Inserts the given item before the position pos.

detaileddescription.para: Inserting the item at position GetMenuItemCount() is the same as appending it.

memberdef.argsstring: (size_t pos, int id, const wxString &item=wxEmptyString, const wxString &helpString=wxEmptyString, wxItemKind kind=wxITEM_NORMAL)
memberdef.name: Insert

briefdescription.para: Inserts the given item before the position pos.

detaileddescription.para: Inserting the item at position GetMenuItemCount() is the same as appending it.

briefdescription.para: Inserts a radio item at the given position.
Inserts a separator at the given position.
Determines whether a menu item is checked.

simplesect.para: true if the menu item is checked, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Determines whether a menu item is enabled.

simplesect.para: true if the menu item is enabled, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Inserts the given item at position 0, i.e.

detaileddescription.para: before all the other existing items.

memberdef.argsstring: (int id, const wxString &item=wxEmptyString, const wxString &helpString=wxEmptyString, wxItemKind kind=wxITEM_NORMAL)
memberdef.name: Prepend

briefdescription.para: Inserts the given item at position 0, i.e.

detaileddescription.para: before all the other existing items.

briefdescription.para: Inserts a checkable item at position 0.
Inserts a radio item at position 0.
Inserts a separator at position 0.
Removes the menu item from the menu but doesn't delete the associated C++ object.

detaileddescription.para: This allows you to reuse the same item later by adding it back to the menu (especially useful with submenus).

parameterdescription.para: The identifier of the menu item to remove.

simplesect.para: A pointer to the item which was detached from the menu.

briefdescription.para: Removes the menu item from the menu but doesn't delete the associated C++ object.

detaileddescription.para: This allows you to reuse the same item later by adding it back to the menu (especially useful with submenus).

simplesect.para: A pointer to the item which was detached from the menu.

briefdescription.para: Sets an item's help string.
Sets the label of a menu item.

parameterdescription.para: The menu item label to set.

briefdescription.para: Sets the title of the menu.

simplesect.para: Notice that you can only call this method directly for the popup menus, to change the title of a menu that is part of a menu bar you need to use wxMenuBar::SetLabelTop().

briefdescription.para: Sends events to source (or owning window if NULL) to update the menu UI.

detaileddescription.para: This is called just before the menu is popped up with wxWindow::PopupMenu, but the application may call it at other times if required.

briefdescription.para: A menu is a popup (or pull down) list of items, one of which may be selected before the menu goes away (clicking elsewhere dismisses the menu).

detaileddescription.para: Menus may be used to construct either menu bars or popup menus.

A menu item has an integer ID associated with it which can be used to identify the selection, or to change the menu item in some way. A menu item with a special identifier wxID_SEPARATOR is a separator item and doesn't have an associated command but just makes a separator line appear in the menu.

Please note that wxID_ABOUT and wxID_EXIT are predefined by wxWidgets and have a special meaning since entries using these IDs will be taken out of the normal menus under MacOS X and will be inserted into the system menu (following the appropriate MacOS X interface guideline). Menu items may be either normal items, check items or radio items. Normal items don't have any special properties while the check items have a boolean flag associated to them and they show a checkmark in the menu when the flag is set. wxWidgets automatically toggles the flag value when the item is clicked and its value may be retrieved using either wxMenu::IsChecked method of wxMenu or wxMenuBar itself or by using wxEvent::IsChecked when you get the menu notification for the item in question.

The radio items are similar to the check items except that all the other items in the same radio group are unchecked when a radio item is checked. The radio group is formed by a contiguous range of radio items, i.e. it starts at the first item of this kind and ends with the first item of a different kind (or the end of the menu). Notice that because the radio groups are defined in terms of the item positions inserting or removing the items in the menu containing the radio items risks to not work correctly.

sect1.title: Allocation strategy
sect1.para: All menus must be created on the heap because all menus attached to a menubar or to another menu will be deleted by their parent when it is deleted. The only exception to this rule are the popup menus (i.e. menus used with wxWindow::PopupMenu()) as wxWidgets does not destroy them to allow reusing the same menu more than once. But the exception applies only to the menus themselves and not to any submenus of popup menus which are still destroyed by wxWidgets as usual and so must be heap-allocated.
As the frame menubar is deleted by the frame itself, it means that normally all menus used are deleted automatically.

sect1.title: Event handling
sect1.para: If the menu is part of a menubar, then wxMenuBar event processing is used.
Note that instead of static EVT_MENU macros you can also use dynamic connection; see Dynamic Event Handling.

simplesect.para: wxMenuBar, wxWindow::PopupMenu, Events and Event Handling, wxFileHistory (most recently used files menu)
